content.raw:
Hi @graffy76 , 
  I recently got sdformat to compile with Visual Studio 2015 and a version of boost with a different layout then the one provided in #!/osrf/sdformat/src/900d9b9475c35862751484bfabc617ce647f5e0c/INSTALL_WIN32.md?at=default&fileviewer=file-view-default . The necessary modifications are part of #!/osrf/sdformat/pull-requests/296/fix-for-compiling-with-visual-studio-and/diff , but I did not experience any problem such as the one that you are describing. 

My suspect is that for some reason something is going wrong in the generation of the Visual Studio solution. If you could attach the `CMakeCache.txt` present in the build directory of sdformat if could be helpful to understand if something went wrong at the CMake level.
content.html:
Hi @graffy76 , I recently got sdformat to compile with Visual Studio 2015 and a version of boost with a different layout then the one provided in #!/osrf/sdformat/src/900d9b9475c35862751484bfabc617ce647f5e0c/INSTALL_WIN32.md?at=default&fileviewer=file-view-default . The necessary modifications are part of #!/osrf/sdformat/pull-requests/296/fix-for-compiling-with-visual-studio-and/diff , but I did not experience any problem such as the one that you are describing.

My suspect is that for some reason something is going wrong in the generation of the Visual Studio solution. If you could attach the CMakeCache.txt present in the build directory of sdformat if could be helpful to understand if something went wrong at the CMake level.
